ARABIC: إِنَّ فِى هَٰذَا لَبَلَٰغًا لِّقَوْمٍ عَٰبِدِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Certainly there is a transmission in this for people who worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Verily there is a message in this for people who are devout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Herein, surely, is a message for those devoted to worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This is a lesson for those who worship (God).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: This Qur’an is sufficient for people who are devout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, in this there is a plain Message for people who worship Allah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely in this is a message to a people who serve
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely in this is a Message delivered unto a people who serve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Herein, surely is a message for true worshippers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily in this in a preaching for a people who are worshippers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There is indeed in this a proclamation for a devout people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily in this (Qur'an) is a Message for people who would (truly) worship Allah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, in this (the Quran) there is a plain Message for people who worship Allah (i.e. the true, real believers of Islamic Monotheism who act practically on the Quran and the Sunnah legal ways of the Prophet SAW).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Surely, in this is a proclamation to a worshiping nation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Indeed, in this is a message for people who worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:106] Indeed there is in this, Qur’ān, a proclamation, sufficient means for [securing] entry into Paradise, for a people who are devout, acting in accordance with [what is stipulated in] it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 361 (Lo! there is) in the Qur'an (a plain statement) sufficiency; it is also said: there is an admonition through the commands and prohibitions (for folk who are devout) for people who declare Allah's divine Oneness.
